Review.Titre: I don't trust TotalAV if we are talking about anti virus.
Review.Contenu: It presents more as a bait then a reputable software and despite not clicking the Submit button as I had changed my trust value at that point, the download brought in a pesky popup that continues to spew out false 'detected trojan..', 'your computer is being hacked..' etc etc continuously disturbing your online work with their popups. I am not the only one having this problem with this unauthorized and hidden install by TotalRV, google 'how to remove pesky totalav popup' and you will find many such complains. I wouldn't trust TotalAV.

Review.Titre: Read the reviews before you purchase VPN service
Review.Contenu: Looking at the reviews and the pricing i switched from current VPN service provide to TotalAV Its been almost 3 weeks and i am not able to use the VPN I contacted the customer service and they are still looking into the issue and i am waiting for them to get back with a solution The very first step to connet  to the VPN is not working and i have done all the troubleshooting steps they have asked me to follow and still it does not work Sadly i am going to discontinue with them after this review as I ran out of pateince of waiting on them its almost a month now . Sad .

TotalAV uses VERY shady tatics to get you to install stuff, such as the classic "Click confirm to verify your not a bot" for the notifications. your notifications are then spammed with stuff like "Your computer/phone has been hacked! Click here to stop spying!" and then it shows a McAfee "virus" scan that says you have like 4+ viruses. then it redirects you to download totalav.

Review.Titre: Not possible to contact the support…

Review.Contenu: I don't even have an account with TOTAL AV yet somehow they have managed to take £367 out of my account without me knowing! This went out in two separate sums and do you think i can find a way to contact them?! I found one telephone number and it didn't work. i did a transaction search and they couldn't find an account. i sent an email and was redirected back to pages i'd gone through before and failed to get a result. i eventually found a page where i could send a ticket but how long is that going to take? This is happening a week before Xmas when i REALLY need that money for Family and Grandchildren! And WHY are there no telephone numbers to ring? It's impossible to get hold of these people and to talk to an actual human being who will look into the issue for you! They obviously don't  want the hassle of having to bother with people and their problems otherwise they would make it easier to get hold of them. I will NEVER use this company for my virus software!  I think they're far too devious to trust.

Review.Titre: these scammers stole 180 euros from me
Review.Contenu: This company are absolute scammers. I added 1 license for 39 euros. I paid with PAYPAL, these fraudsters have added my address for automatic payment and withdrawn 180 euros. After that my card was blocked and they tried to take money 15 more times but because my card was blocked they didn't succeed. At the moment they are holding me 180 euros which I will probably never get. I urge you not to fall for their fraudulent scheme. They explain that they will protect my computer, but they took the money from me in the most impudent way and will not return it to me. Absolute scammers run away from such companies.

I got a hit on my card today (wasn't even supposed to renew in November), thankfully, it declined.  I've been chatting with another associate for 30 minutes for the same hard sell/guilt trip to close the account.  Whatever you do, do NOT buy this software. Closing your account is a nightmare.

I installed this anti-virus program because the rating was good. The customer service appalling. All devices we have this program on are slower and have even more malware or unwanted ads than before. When reviewing my bank statements, I found numerous charges (at different time and amounts) all from this company. After taking days to finally getting in touch with an actual human, instead of trying to help resolve the issues surrounding their software's inability to protect from malware, they just offered a refund of the overcharges.  When I asked them how about resolving the malware issues your software didn't catch, the service rep hung up on me. Further the software places adds promoting different modules you can buy to further protect your computers for additional charges. These all seem mostly related to internet browser security and email protection and are seen everytime you open an internet browser. Very disappointed.

I could not easily contact customer service and when I finally did manage it was only a "live chat" where the operator kept me waiting ages between responses. Review.Titre: Did its job too well, now I have corrupted files.
Review.Contenu: It did its job in removing some threats alright, but it did it a little too well. I purchased this program not even 24 hrs ago and it already deleted some important windows 11 files and corrupted a bunch of other files on my computer. I am now on hour 4 with remote tech support trying to resolve the issue, and it looks like it's going to be even longer. It seems to have a large margin of error in discerning if a threat is actual or not. On the safer side it gets the less obvious security risks. On the downside you could lose hours of work time trying to resolve how to get important missing files back.Edit. Changed it to one star, because total av doesn't even have proper customer support to even discuss this matter as after 9 hours of trying to fix my computer. After going through different tech supports It went no where. Double Edit: you better hope you never have any issues. They won't do a damn thing for you. Even canceling and getting a refund was like pulling teeth.To anyone that reads this, just go with Norton.

Avoid this company , they have a business model  of enticing customers with cheap offers and then increasing the charge yearly by 500%.There service is very poorly rated by proffesional people and thia can be verified by using google AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COSTS  -I all so belive they are actively manipulating  trust pilot so it seems they have good reviews

Review.Titre: I had TotalAV installed on both my…
Review.Contenu: I had TotalAV installed on both my desktop and laptop computers.I paid a monthly payment via my debit card/banking account.Several weeks ago I contacted TotalAV Support and cancelled my subscriptions for both computers.Customer Service confirmed my cancellations Yesterday I noticed on my bank statement that TotalAV has charged me again.Contacted their Support Service and apparently the issue has not been corrected and will be "investigated"by their billing department.I contacted my bank - the only way that I can prevent any further charges from TotalAV is to cancel my debit card(a "stop payment"is only for checking accounts!!)

Review.Titre: TotalAV misses in the customer service department.
Review.Contenu: I decided to try TotalAV on a whim and used the free version. However, I decided that I did not need the service, so I removed TotalAV from my device. I attempted to delete my free account but was unable to do so, and thus reached out to see if my account could be deleted. I sent multiple emails to multiple addresses and received the same generated response. I called the phone number and was merely directed to the website. Essentially, I was left without answers and couldn't access my free account without purchasing the paid version of TotalAV.I am frustrated with the lack of genuine communication. At the very least, TotalAV needs an actual person to respond to emails and/or phone calls. While its antivirus is well reviewed, I've found that TotalAV doesn't get the simple things right, namely customer service, which is concerning for interested buyers.

Absolute scam company that tried to take a payment of £1.99 from my card today without my knowledge. I cancelled my subscription a month or two ago after they didn't give me the service when I had paid for. I paid through my phone contract and never got an active subscription for that month. I logged into my account today to try and delete my card details and account. Nope. Can't do that they don't give you the option to remove the card and when I tried to delete the account it said it has an active subscription whilst displaying I should renew and wouldn't let me delete it. I want all my details removed before I seek legal action. You operate in the UK and we have strict GDPR laws (data handling laws). If you don't remove my details and card information within 48 hours I'll seek legal action.

When I tried to close my account, I realised  they had made it as difficult as possible to find any inforamtion on their website explaining how to do it. I googled and searched for ages and found that lots of other people had the same experience. In the end, all I could do was email them. They then signed me up to OTHER offers which they said would be 'free'. They did not want to close my account and tried every trick in the book to stop me. I have never encountered such persistence, or sub obtuse behaviour. I do not like the way find these people do business and only hope that they have now closed my account. I really don't know!

Useless Product!  They are highly unresponsive.  Attempted to get technical assistance several times.  They do not have help links for Help Tickets or Chat on their support page or the product 'Dashboard'.  The product does not support all browsers.Had to contact a 3rd party just to get information on how to contact them.Unable to use Total Password with Firefox (my primary browser) and Total Password will not import the .csv file I exported from McAfee TrueKey. No money has been taken this time as we cancelled the subscription. We tried to email them about this invoice, to ensure that the sub has been fully cancelled, but all you get in reply to emails is an automated response referring you the their help pages. I have now removed it from my PC .

In desperation I searched thecontact phone number, to find it is actually the contact number for a CLEANING business, so it seems that they don’t even monitor their own website. After more than 2 days of trying to solve the problem I have given up…and Uninstalled TotalAv. Don't be lured by the cheap cost which skyrockets anyway upon renewal I paid $97 for a product ruined by its poor & unprofessional interface and NO COMMUNICATION.

Review.Titre: I switched Virus Protection to Avast then Total AV
Review.Contenu: I switched Virus Protection to Avast and they installed  P C App Store which now has a virus - McFee Advert - etc. can not be uninstalled (nwjs). Purchased Total AV Total Security (includes popup blocker). McFee still popping up - showed they made it inactive. Can not contact Total AV. No email, phone number, or chat is available. Appears Total AV is a Total Joke.    Update--------------Got a reply from Total (Still Joke) apparently they didn't read what I wrote. It was one specific item giving me a problem P C App Store installed by Avast. That particular version of that program can not be uninstalled and is located and run from a user folder of Windows. The message from Total was install our software from a clean operating system install or it may not work. Sure --- I will dump and reinstall all 66 installed programs after I reinstall the OS and 3.7Tb of data and hope your program might then pick up things in the future. NOT. Windows Security finally found the problem and took care of it. Thanks Bill.

Now after stopping it my spam has reduced greatly even after a few days I do not get half as much and dwindling down daily. Also it kept turning off so you had to keep turning it on it was terrible. Review.Titre: Beware of TotalAV billing practices and advertising woes.

The website says 100% money back guarantee but no luck here. Be aware of TAVs billing practices. If I ever hear back from them I will post there response here. Don't hold your breath its been 2 weeks now.Update: It's been over 2wks and no refund. What can I say, people.

i dont understand your pricing, it shows $100 off for full pkg yet it is asking if i want each additional protection at an added discounted rate. no thank you, if that is the offer please delete. i will de activate the account if so.

Connected with their tech support who had no idea why the alerts kept popping up despite that nothing of their software 'totalav' was found in my applications (reminder: I did not download nor installed so it was unauthorized access). Their tech support had no idea how to remove the annoying notifications every 5-10 mins and asked that I bring my Mac to a local tech geek. Sadly, it's like welcoming a 'thief' who then says they are protecting your PC. So many of the anti virus nowadays are this 'self fulfilling prophecy' ploy so be careful. Review.Titre: Being charged for products that you didn't ask for.
Review.Contenu: A common thread running through many of the reviews that I have read of this company, is that people have made a small 'one off' payment for a service, only to find that they that they have signed up to a subscription to that or even more products that they were completely unaware off.In my case, I responded to an ad. offering Antivirus PRO for the much reduced price of £1.99. I was more than happy to give it a go for that price, believing that if I wasn't satisfied with it, it wasn't very much to lose.Imagine my horror when later in the day I received a communication from my bank warning me of possible fraud because they were querying not just the £1.99 but a further £39.00 for another product, of which I knew nothing. According to TotalAV I had agreed to buy a subscription for Safe Browsing (VPN) as well, where both were subscriptions that were due to be renewed at a later date.Fortunately, my bank was on the ball. After a short conversation where they informed me that they were unable to stop the payments, they gave me a phone number that allowed me to contact to the accounts department of TotalAV directly, and that I should speak to them about cancelling. To be fair to TotalAV I spoke to a very helpful and polite gentleman who eventually cancelled all payments and subscriptions with the promise of a refund within 48 hours. However, he did offer other other services for free or reduced rates which I politely declined. I told him that a bond of trust between myself and his company had been broken.On reading the reviews, it appears that the management response  in most cases is to assure it's clients that all costs will be refunded - and so far I have no reason to deny this. However I have yet to read a response that explains why they sign people up by stealth for services they haven’t asked for.I am interested to find out and await response.For your information the direct number to their accounts department is 0800357602.

I recently had an unfortunate experience with TotalAV and felt compelled to share my dissatisfaction. I purchased their antivirus program for 29.0 euros, but due to a confusing website interface, I unintentionally subscribed to additional features, incurring extra charges of 170 euros.When I reached out to their customer care, the experience was appalling. The first agent was dismissive and unhelpful, insisting that I would not be charged beyond the initial 29.0 euros. Subsequently, my bank flagged suspicious transactions attempting to charge the additional 170 euros.Upon contacting customer care again, the second agent, after an unusually long conversation, conveniently ended the chat, claiming it was due to a system error. This felt like a deliberate attempt to avoid addressing the issue. My attempts to seek resolution through customer care have been a nightmare and made my lose any trust in this company. And after reading the reviews on this website-which I wish I had done previously!-I decided to have my account cancelled and request a refund for the 29.0 euros. The third agent I spoke to was even worse! She treated me as if I were unreasonable for seeking a refund for a money they never received according to her! And to make matters worse, she unilaterally ended the chat, leaving me without any resolution except for "Check with your bank and call us again"!The Help Center and live chat proved to be utterly useless, redirecting me in circles without resolving the problem. The lack of transparency and unhelpful customer service have left me deeply dissatisfied.I hope others can learn from my experience, and I strongly advise potential customers to exercise caution. The company's inability to address and resolve customer issues reflects poorly on their commitment to customer satisfaction.

Review.Titre: How was this not detected by Total AV
Review.Contenu: First, why when I come on here to write a review from my phone which has Total AV Premium running on it, & I go to hit 2 stars, my phone freezes & wont do anything, yet I hit 5 stars it opens right up?  Their operating systems is not very clear, or maybe it’s just my ignorance however when I go to the icon & open up Total AV, go into my account info.  It shows my devices & that I’m protected, yet there is a Download Now button there?  This to me, is confusing.  I purchased Total AV Premium because I don’t have home Wi-Fi & have to run my laptop on an open network. Last week  my Facebook account was froze due to inappropriate content being posted.  Because this was ‘out of the norm’ I was contacted by FB that someone had hacked my account & that they had froze the account until I was able to retrieve it.  Upon investigating this I also discovered unfamiliar devices logged into my Google & my Apple account. By fault of my own, due to a billing issue, I had a lapse in my coverage from Total AV for a couple of days & I am assuming this happened during the lapse of coverage.  I am definitely not very cybersecurity savvy, however I don’t understand how, I have 3 separate devices: cell phone, an IPad an an Apple Laptop, all 3 with Total AV Premium installed & running on them, have run scans & I have not received at least an alert from Total AV.  How is this possible & is this not what the protection is for?  I do not blame Total AV for this, due to my coverage lapse, however I feel this should have been detected.

Review.Titre: Beware! Maybe a good antivirus but poor and time-wasting customer care
Review.Contenu: My mother acquired a TotalAv subscription in the hopes that a paid antivirus would work well and serve her purposes. However, after a first small payment, the company upped the amount and after a year or two, were charging a much much higher rate.We wrote an email as requested on the website's terms and conditions, only to receive responses that totally ignored our requests. Sometimes they were simply warning us that a computer without their anti-virus was vulnerable, another time they offered us some reductions, together with some free offers, but they never acknowledged our request to have a refund and cancel the contract.This continued for various emails, both ignoring our requests to cancel the contract and our requests for a refund.So this is a warning: the anti-virus may even be effective but the customer care is appalling. Likewise, beware that if you sign up you may be faced with an automatic renewal that you aren't requested and also may see the price of the contract spiral upwards. Finally, our case is not alone. There are many, many other reviews of cases online (TrustPilot, BestBusinessBureau, Reddit), that describe exactly the same situation, ie NO cancellation and NO refund.Beware!*EDIT: since I last wrote, TotalAV have infact refunded most or all of the money spent on the rather high subscription. For this reason, I am upping my review from 1 to 2 stars.

This is my first time rating something and I did it because I'm angry again. I also did it because I don't want anyone else to be caught off guard.First things first, Total AV is a good antivirus program which never gives me trouble and the troubles I had were easy enough to fix.The problem is with billing. The first two years were alright but in the third year the bill was to high and I'm not talking about higher than than sign up bonus which would be normal, I'm talking about higher than the "normal" rate promised on the website. Instead of paying 117,81 € like in my second year for the antivirus pro suscribtion, they tried to charge me €141.61. After talking to costumer support, they offered me an discount of 85%. Only paying the regular price would have been fine with me. Last year they charged me for €149,00. This was after they promised the year before they weren't going to this. I tried to reason with them again, but this time I didn't get a refund as they said they would terminate my suscribtion. The end of the story is that I had to terminate my suscribtion this year myself because they tried to charge me €165.41. Let's see how this goes.To summerize:- Good antivirus program- Be careful around billing time, because they charge you more than the suscribtion amount and try to bury the new prices, which are vastly different from the ones posted online, in the lower sections of an E-Mail.

Review.Titre: I needed the protection this company…
Review.Contenu: I needed the protection this company was offering. However after downloading the apps I wanted and making provision for a single payment my bank contacted me 3 hours later with an urgent warning about unauthorised payments . I spent some time talking to the fraud and retail arms of my bank, they confirmed that this company had taken 3 payments instead of the single one authorised. I emailed the company who said they would refund within 7 days. But they did nor argue or present any explanation of why the payments had been taken. At the very least I felt the company's financial operations are sloppy, and therefore have no confidence in their general ability to keep me safe and happy. So I have cancelled all their services and now use a competitor. This hasn't prevented an incessant stream of aggravating advertising to persuade me to rejoin them. All I can say is that their business model and protocols for customer service are not for me, and many others on these pages agree.

Review.Titre: You frustrated me with moving forward…
Review.Contenu: You frustrated me with moving forward with the install

For the average person - Be aware TotalAV will use deceptive marketing tactics to suggest that everything is included in the 'pro' version, when in fact it is not, and then strongly imply you must buy a bunch of extras. The purchase options for these are bright green labelled as "activate X" and "activate Y" - for time poor people it looks as though you are activating included extras, when in fact you are purchasing extra; so a $19 deal suddenly becomes $119 on automatic subscription. If you try to cancel, it requires multiple emails, logins and following various email links, with multiple confirmation steps (one of more honestly could be easily missed for the less savvy).....Sneaky tactics undermine what otherwise I'm told should have been a good product, put me right off these guys for future. And yes these tactics are common and used in many places, but seriously, it's been a rough time globally, it's time to be the bigger guy and give the average consumer who's just trying to get by an F-ing break.

Review.Titre: I feel like I have been scammed
Review.Contenu: I feel like I have been scammed. I searched the web for “Best antivirus “ and this company came out with lots of Trusst Pilot 4+ stars and an apparently great rating. Then I went to their website and they tricked me into buying a much more expensive product than I wanted or needed. I kept trying to just buy the one computer, one antivirus solution which would have cost me an affordable £45. However, every time I tried to check-out, the message on the screen told me that “for only £39”… , I could have extra security and features, which I “must” need and the pricing is deceptive….as if they had priced the first main antivirus at £44 and the second, “must have” at £40 they would be same total price, but at the prices they showed, it tricks you into thinking that you won’t be paying so much (…. Just a total of £80!! ). Then, I found it difficult to find the information about Unsubscribe and having read some of the reviews here about how people found that even when they unsubscribed they were still charged, I am not confident that I won’t be charged. Edit: Additionally, after managing to unsubscribe, I was sent repeated emails that told me that I would no longer be covered if I didn’t re-subscribe! (I paid for a full years cover so It isn’t like I am saying I will not pay my monthly subscription). And, the company want my personal details (an email sent via the TrustPilot site to me, stated that unless I filled in the form with my personal details, my review here would be taken down. ! I really feel that it just doesn’t benefit anyone if one takes the time to write a fact based, honest review that happens to be negative and states why the negative review has been written. Now, I am worrying that my personal details may be used by this company for nefarious purposes. How does any person with who is struggling with the minefield that is computer protection, cope ? Not everyone has access to more computer literate children, or IT department personnel who can advise. I looked up the consumer body, ‘Which’ and couldn’t even find this company listed in their “Best Antivirus “ reviews, so I feel that I have been unduly swayed by looking at the ‘Trust Pilot’ reviews that this company plastered all over their advertising on the web search page. Additionally, I do not want to install this AV on my computer after reading negative reviews here about how difficult it has been for those people in said reviews, to remove the program from their computers. Conclusion: I have just spent £80 for nothing. I wish I had simply given it to a charity, as they would have benefitted. Yes, I should have researched more thoroughly before I spent the money, but I do feel that their advertising and their sign up page were very deceptive and persuasive, unlike some other very good products, that Which magazine praise for their products and because they have free antivirus software that works very well (unless you are browsing indiscriminately or do need a more comprehensive program).
Far too many questions. I just wanted protection.

I may be old fashioned, but I like to have the freedom to renew my licenses manually and not via auto-renewal unless I have specifically chosen to do so myself. Thus, I bought the 19 Euro offer and then turned of auto-renewal in my account (which was quite easy). One thing that I didn't like is that some of the functionality is turned off only because you change the way to renew the license – they were included in the 19 Euro deal. After all changing the way to pay does not mean that I will not renew – if I think the program does a good job.This is an email I received today:“Some time ago, you chose to deactivate your automatic renewal of your TotalAV service. After November 14, 2024, you will no longer be able to access your account.Not only that, but in 48 hours, you'll also lose all the additional services you've received, at no extra cost, as part of our great Continuous Protection package.”Other malware scanners (like Malware bytes)  detects total av as a malware, which is a bit concerning (although it could be a way to try to get rid of a competitor). Some sites consider total av as a scam, or rogue programs (including Wikipedia), why it is hardly surprising that many people are skeptical about the program.It would be good to get comments/explanations from TotalAV Customer Care Team or someone else at the company concerning the scam/rogue accusations. Even Wikipedia can be wrong of course. And things can have changed since 2019, when the Wikipedia article was written.Added 11/22/2023After reading the answer from the Customer Care Team I am not much wiser. The answer is almost identical to every other answer they have given. I wanted them to comment on their classifications as a rough company/software by wikipedia (check their "List_of_rogue_security_software"), and other sites and forums that has classified them as scam. Thus it becomes kind of nonsensical to ask for my phone number and additional email info, (I gave trustpilot my email to begin with). The answers are robotic/AI-like.I was also unpleasantly surprised by a mail from trustpilot where they tell me that my review may be deleted within two day's unless I comply with total ai:s requests (i.e. giving them additional contact details). That is also odd as I gave them three stars and wrote that I may well renew my license depending on my experience of the software over the coming year. By the way this is what trustpilot wrote to me:"TotalAV would love to understand your experience better, so they’ve asked for more details about your review—like an order number or email.If we don’t hear from you within 3 days, your review may be taken offline."I assume they don't do that with five-star reviews...

Review.Titre: Better deals if you try to cancel you auto-sub
Review.Contenu: Have had TotalAV for several years.  Assume that at nearly £200 p.a. it's been telling the truth when it scans etc, so had nothing to grumble about.  No longer need personal anti-vac as back under company scheme, so with 6-months left on my 'service' plan, I tried to cancel and ideally get a refund for those months.  The 2 email addresses I had on joining correspondence and which I was advised to use bounced back, so I went on the website and tried to cancel there, it took some time to find a page which wasn't FAQ info.  On the page where I could act, the verification code never appeared in my email, and told me that I couldn't re-try and to wait 2 mins.  This I did and the same message appeared, so I went to the 'livechat' bot who then passed me to someone who confirmed they were human.  The responses were very slow and the first 20 mins were frustrating as all they did was encourage me not to cancel.  They gave me a new verification code and tried to cease the chat.  I told them to remain on line which was smart on my part because the code didn't work.  They gave me another number which did, the cancellation process then started and took me to screens offering me ever increasing discounts to renew next year which as I refused went up each time I declined.  The final one was 60% off - this exceeded the 50% refund I was requesting for leaving 6 months into the annual contract.  Got back to livechat and she asked me what further discount I would accept to stay.  I pointed out that they were now offering me a discount that exceeded my refund request, so give me the refund.  She refused again, matter closed. 45 mins of my time for an over-lengthy process that jaded my view of TotalAV.  It wasn't about not getting a refund it was the number of barriers put in the way to cancelling.  The refund policy is 30 days after renewal for a 12 month plan.  Had I known I would not be working from home any more in May/June I could have got a refund and had I tried to leave at this years auto-renewal I would have only paid 40% of what I did.  Be smart and use this information to get a better deal if you join and want to renew.

Review.Titre: TotalAV seems to be good software but Customer Service is lacking
Review.Contenu: TotalAV seems to be good software that, for the most part, does exactly what is intended.  That's why I chose 4 Stars.  I wonder about Ad Block because I still see a lot of ad pop-ups at various times, especially about TotalAV products! Another concern I have is that it seems sometimes it is difficult for the Customer Service group (mostly in India that I've spoken with) to understand my concerns or questions.  Therefore it has taken two or three calls to get my concern answered.Another concern is that the charges for software vary all over the place.  Therefore is quite possible not to know what a charge is for when you first see it on your credit card.Lastly, I don't like that I can't get a refund on a product that I have not installed or used at all (confirmed by TotalAV), only because the time lapse is more than a two or three months since I purchased the product.

I haven't used TrustPilot, however I believe it will be a good experience once I start.  What I did not like is that I tried to load TotalAV onto this computer, it didn't load but I continued to get ad pop-ups about TrustPilot.  That was annoying!

It works really smooth. I have had others that locked up my computer. TOTAL AV NEVER LOCKED UP MY COMPUTER! In fact I NEVER had an issue. So I WILL CONTINUE TO USE TOTAL AV FOR ALL MY OPTIMIZING AND PROTECTION NEED!!!
